definition: A client-optimized programming language for fast apps on any platform, developed by Google.
Google's UI toolkit for building natively compiled applications for mobile, web, and desktop from a single codebase.
A named storage location that holds data of a specific type.
A reusable block of code that performs a specific task and can be called from other parts of the program.
A blueprint or template for creating objects that define their properties and behaviors.
An instance of a class that has state (attributes) and behavior (methods).
An ordered collection of objects where each object can be accessed by its index position.
An unordered collection of unique objects where each object appears only once.
A collection of key-value pairs where each key maps to exactly one value.
A special method that is called when creating an object to initialize its properties.
A mechanism where a class inherits properties and methods from another class (parent class).
The ability of objects of different types to be treated as objects of a common type.
An event that occurs during the execution of a program that disrupts the normal flow of instructions.
A mechanism for handling exceptions by trying a block of code and catching any exceptions that occur.
A feature that prevents null reference errors by making nullability explicit in the type system.
A value that will be available at some point in the future, typically from an asynchronous operation.
Keywords used for asynchronous programming to write code that can wait for operations to complete.
A symbol that tells the compiler to perform specific mathematical or logical operations.
A control structure that repeats a block of code until a specified condition is met.
A statement that executes different code blocks based on whether a condition is true or false.
A variable that receives values when a function is called.
The value that a function sends back to the calling code after completing its task.
The ability of the compiler to automatically determine the type of a variable based on its value.
A typing system where variable types are known at compile time.
A typing system where variable types are determined at runtime.
A feature that allows writing code that works with different types while maintaining type safety.
A way to reuse code in multiple class hierarchies without multiple inheritance.
A contract that defines what methods a class must implement.
A class that cannot be instantiated and may contain abstract methods that must be implemented by subclasses.
A collection of Dart libraries and tools that can be shared and reused across projects.
A collection of related code that can be imported and used in other Dart programs.
A statement that brings code from a library into the current file.
A statement that makes code from a library available to other libraries that import it.
The entry point of every Dart program where execution begins.
A built-in function used to display text output to the console.
Non-executable text that explains what the code does and is ignored by the compiler.
The set of rules that define the structure and meaning of statements in a programming language.
The process of converting source code into machine code or bytecode that can be executed.
The period during which a program is executing, as opposed to compile time.
The process of finding and fixing errors or bugs in code.
Integrated Development Environment - a software application that provides comprehensive facilities for software development.
Software Development Kit - a collection of tools and libraries for developing software applications.
